span.span: In partnership with the home and community, Shiloh Village School District 85's mission is to provide an extraordinary education to stimulate each individual's adventure of

div.p: -----------------Click here to read our Wildcats Roar e-Newspaper!

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: center;

span.br: Th regularly scheduled school board meeting will be conducted via teleconference. We will be using the Zoom platform and encourage public attendance. If you wish to attend by being invited, please email dsauer@shi85.org by 6 pm Monday, April 20th.

br.span:
Good Evening!
Today Governor Pritzker announced the suspension of in-person learning for the remainder of the school year. Although it is sad we will not be able to finish the school year in-person, we understand it is for the greater health and safety of our communities. Just because in-person learning is suspended, learning does not have to stop. At this time, Shiloh plans to continue to support our students through the District's Remote Learning Plan for the remainder of the school year, which is May 22nd.
As a school district our priorities remain:
1st - Feed and care for the extended safety, health, and welfare of our students, families, non-student children, staff, and community at large.
2nd - Provide continuity of learning focused on critical standards and minimize instructional loss through remote learning.
Our meal distribution has been very successful, and we have served hundreds of meals a week since mid-March. This would not be possible without the hard work of our food service employees, our support staff, and faculty who help make it happen.
Monday begins another two-week increment of remote learning, and we thank everyone for their patience and efforts to navigate this new course together. We understand that everyone is doing the best they can and will continue to support everyone's best efforts throughout this process.
I will continue to update you with specific details for the implications of this decision on our district, students, and families. In the coming weeks, we will begin to address several end of the year events and celebrations that will need to be postponed or cancelled.
Though this announcement may not come as a surprise to some, to others this is now realization that the end of the school year will be different than what we would have hoped. As we have in the last month, we will continue to face this reality together.
Shiloh Strong!
Dale Sauer

span.br:
I hope you and your families had a joyous and safe Easter. As you know, Shiloh teachers and staff have been working hard with our Remote Learning Plan to provide educational opportunities to our students during the closure. We have been planning our educational delivery laid out daily in two-week increments. This gives our students and families structure and guidance as they go through their learning at home. At this time, schools remain closed until April 30th. Out next planned learning increment begins on Monday, April 20th and runs through April 30th.
Packet and and/or supplemental materials for all Pre-K through 4th grade may be picked up at Shiloh Middle School this Friday, April 17th, from 8 AM to 5 PM.
Our 5th through 8th grade lessons are entirely electronic, and materials will only be available for our students without internet access or in need of printed material. If you have a student in need of electronic access in grades 3 through 8, please reach out to Mr. Loepker or me.
MEALS:
We will deliver meals tomorrow, Thursday and Friday of this week. Beginning next week, Monday, April 20th, we will deliver meals only every other day of the week on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. On those days, we will be delivering two meals at a time. This is done in an effort to decrease the number of social contacts in our community and to keep all of us safer.
Locations:
11:16 AM SHILOH VILLAGE PARK PLAYGROUND (WATER TOWER)
11:32 AM VALLEY VIEW MOBILE HOME PARK PLAYGROUND ON TOBIAS DR
11:48 AM LAKE SUZANNE MOBILE HOME PARK OFFICE
12:03 PM SIR LAWRENCE DRIVE & LEBANON AVENUE
12:19 PM CHIPPEWA DR & BARTON DR
11:00 AM-12:15 PM SHILOH MIDDLE SCHOOL

div.div: Shiloh Village School District Shiloh students scored in the top 10% of area schools while keeping instructional spending at $4,902 compared to the state average of $7,094 per pupil.

Shiloh Elementary School The Creative Learning Program is a great place for parents to provide before and after school care. The program offers a variety of learning opportunities and activities in addition to a safe environment.

Shiloh Middle School The middle school offers a variety of extra, after-school programming for students whose interests lie outside of team sports such as ping pong, golf, ultimate frisbee, French, scrapbooking, electronic gaming, chess, dodgeball, and scholar bowl.
